article.headline: Furman 73, Western Carolina 66
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Eric Webb scored 18 points all on 3-pointers as Furman beat Western Carolina 73-66 on Monday night. Webb's 3-pointer from well beyond the top of the key gave the Paladins (12-8, 5-3 Southern Conference) the lead for good with just over five minutes to go. Webb followed the shot with an assist to Moussa Diagne on a breakaway layup, and Furman hit six of nine free throws down the stretch to beat the Catamounts (7-15, 2-7) for the fifth straight time. Nicholas Sanders added a career-high 16 points and Robby Bostain scored 10 for the Paladins. David Berghoefer scored a season-high 26 points and pulled down eight rebounds and Trey Hopkins added 19 points and five assists for Western Carolina, who has lost all 10 of its road games.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
